citation.article-title: Alterococcus agarolyticus, gen. nov., sp. nov., a halophilic thermophilic bacterium capable of agar degradation.

p.s: Description of Alterococcus agarolyticus sp. nov.
Alterococcus agarolyticus (a.gar.o.ly'ti.cus. Malayan n. agar agar, a complex gelling polysaccharide from marine red algae; Gr. adj. lyticus dissolving; M.L. adj. agarolyticus agar-dissolving)
Cell spherical, normally 0.8-0.9 μm in diameter and occurring mostly singly or in pairs.
Able to liquify agar and ferment glucose, cellobiose, galactose, lactose, sucrose, trehalose, and xylose.
Young colonies on agar media are white, circular, and opaque.
Optical growth occurs are about 48°C and 2% NaCl.
Cells are susceptible to ampicillin, chloramphenicol, erythromycin, penicillin G, and tetracycline.
Strain ADT3 has a G+C content of 65.8 mol% and is the type strain of Alterococcus agarolyticus.
This strain has been deposited in the Culture Center for Research and Collection, Taiwan as strain CCRC19135.
